Posts.Content: Thank you. I make an apology if I didn't respect a protocol here. I'll try to post the information required, even if I am not positive I have all the info... -Age 41 - Age of diagnosis or time since diagnosis –I am 41 now, and I discovered a lump in January 2005, but was able to see a doctor only December 2006 - Not menop. at diagnosis, menopausal now - Specific type of cancer : ductal carcinoma in situ grade II/III, absence of HER2 - Stage at diagnosis : bone metastasis - Treatments: hormonotherapy (Zoladex, Aredia, Tamoxifen)
Posts.Title: IP6 supplement

Posts.Content: Muttsmom, thank you. I'll follow your suggestions. At first, they wanted to operate, then they discovered my bone metastasis and they said it is better not to operate. I had no chemo, I began with hormono. I'll ask for all these things you told me about...

Posts.Content: ... as far as I know. My onc. doesn't tell me anything. Do you think that I could ask for a copy of my results? I am not convinced that he is one of the best... and even if I have this huge doubt about the 3months Zoladex, I hesitate to ask hm if a monthly one wouldn't be better. He is an Arab doctor (according to his name) and, you know, they tend to feel easily insulted... ... I might need your help here: maybe you could suggest a list of questions to ask him on my next appointment... The fact that you are surprised with my diagnosis worries me.

Posts.Content: Greetings, I began my hormonotherapy May 2007 with Aredia (each month), Tamoxifen (daily) and Zoladex (every three months). I read that the 1 month Zoladex is considered better than the 3 months one. Is there anyone in the same situation, or a similar one? Thank you.
Posts.Title: Zoladex in breast cancer with bone metastasis
